review:
Update 
After I posted my review, customer support contacted me the same day. A case was opened and fixed in two days after they figured out what was going on. Thanks for the quick response 

[Previous review]
When I first downloaded the app it worked however I got a new iPhone in November. My old iPhone had a touchID and my new iPhone has faceID. According to the app I‚Äôm only allowed one biometric scan so I couldn‚Äôt switch to faceID. I contacted customer support to fix the issue. After uninstalling/reinstalling the app, resetting the password, etc., per the advice of customer service, the app no longer works. While I can login on my desktop, the app keeps giving me the same invalid credentials message when I try to log in. The app was nice when it worked but now it‚Äôs useless.
title: App doesn‚Äôt work

developerResponse: {'id': 25205150, 'body': "Hello. I‚Äôm so sorry you haven't been pleased with the app or your plan. Please email me at LetUsHelpU@cigna.com. I would like to look into each piece of your experience. -CM", 'modified': '2021-09-20T10:45:25Z'}
review:
You expect that an online app will be accurate. Not with Cigna. I was called this morning and was told that my eligibility was confirmed and my insurance card was on the My Cigna app. Not true. There was a card online but it was populated with out of date information. I discovered this at Walgreens after waiting in line and being told that the BIN and PCN numbers were in error and my six prescriptions would not be covered by Cigna until they were corrected. 

I fully expect that Cigna will soon correct their errors but I do not why they allow the application to post out of date information. Had they posted that information was being updated and a revised medical card would be available in 24 hours I would understand and I would have avoided a public discussion concerning the online insurance card and why it was no longer accepted. 

Cigna‚Äôs errors and omissions are sadly not limited to bad data.  Their supposedly professional staff (Rn‚Äôs not MD‚Äôs) are quite willing to debate medical issues with cardiologists and their staff. Ultimately the doctors rule the day but only after wasting time by the doctor, patient and pharmacist.  These issues are rarely documented in the patient‚Äôs file resulting a repeat performance by fresh Walgreen personnel who are ignorant of the past history and who are quite willing to further expose their ignorance in a refreshed debate.
title: Do not trust

review:
It‚Äôs a bit archaic these days to have an app that you have to physically input a password every time. There‚Äôs no Face ID option. I have to go into my phone‚Äôs password storage each time and search for Cigna to pull up what my password is, and it‚Äôs frankly just kind of a time waster. Especially as the mobile website will fill in the password automatically (although, I have to submit to two-factor authentication when I go that route, despite having already checked the ‚Äòremember me on this device‚Äô box üôÑ). Also, you can‚Äôt pay your premium or bills on the app! That‚Äôs‚Ä¶ ridiculous. After wasting my time hunting fruitlessly on the app for a way to pay, I went to the website. Makes me wonder why there‚Äôs an app at all! 

That said, the app is set up in a user-friendly way. I like the way ‚Äúfind care‚Äù part is divvied up to help you determine the best option for your current situation. But last week, while attempting to set up a virtual appointment, I ran into a bug and couldn‚Äôt complete my registration. I had to start over completely on the website. Which, again, just wasted my time and irritated me. How does this app have such a high rating?
title: Doesn‚Äôt save login info

developerResponse: {'id': 20203316, 'body': "Hello. I'm so sorry for all you've experienced with the app and I'd be glad to look into the issue for you. Please email me at LetUsHelpU@cigna.com. We're always here to help. -CM", 'modified': '2021-01-06T00:15:27Z'}
review:
For the last month or so, none of my claims appear in the app. It‚Äôs bizarre - I have many many medical claims from the last 180 days, yet when I try to view them in the app, it says ‚ÄúYou have no claims in this period.‚Äù I then go on the Cigna website and can see all the claims, some of which were processed only a week prior. It‚Äôs like the app can‚Äôt connect to their database for some reason; it‚Äôs really bizarre and makes the app next to useless.

Furthermore, it‚Äôs 2021; there should be a SIMPLE, automated, electronic secure system with which us CIGNA customers can submit our claims. There isn‚Äôt - they still demand that people physically mail their claim forms in, which is time-consuming, error prone, and wasteful.

Get your act together, CIGNA; you‚Äôre supposed to be among the higher-end providers in the US. Start acting like it. I do know a ton of recruiters have reached out to me recently trying to fill technical positions at CIGNA (I‚Äôm a software developer), so hopefully they recognize and implement the critical features that remain missing from their service.
title: It‚Äôs ‚Äúokay‚Äù... when it‚Äôs actually working

review:
Wife and I have been with Cigna Medicare since they have been in Arizona.  I believe that covers over thirty years. We have been mostly pleased with the care we have received, especially with hospitalizations and serious treatments.

I wear a hearing aid and was especially please to see a $1400 allowance for the devices.  However, it was only an allowance in products sold by Cigna Audiology. The allowance disappears when the products offered are in the $5,000 range. Tech and quality product availability has produced hearing aids significantly less expensive.  For example, I had purchased an excellent pair four years ago from Costco. Their testing was free, service beyond exceptional and the prices thousands of dollars less expensive  I wear the Re Sound, which is Bluetooth compatible. I filed a request several months ago to allow me to apply the $1400 to products like this from other sources .  I never heard back.  That is so unlike Cigna,I wonder why. Will someone have the courtesy to respond to that request?
title: Significant Complaint

developerResponse: {'id': 20795674, 'body': "Hello. I'm so sorry for the trouble you've experienced when trying to log into the app. Please email me at LetUsHelpU@cigna.com. We're always here to help. -CM", 'modified': '2021-02-02T02:48:12Z'}

ORIGINAL COMMENTS: After getting a repeated login error message, three calls to Cigna tech support totaling 30 minutes, being told (twice) to delete and reinstall the app, being told to change my password using the website, being told to limit my password to 11 characters (despite the website instructions to make it 8-12 characters) because the app doesn‚Äôt handle 12-character passwords well, all to no avail...

I give up and will just log into the Cigna page on AOL using my dial-up modem. Maybe they have a MySpace page or an island on Second Life where I can see my insurance information.

review: Has many extremely useful features and an amazingly well thought out, user friendly base design, but if I can‚Äôt review things because it is constantly updating, refreshing, or whatever else it is doing and kicking be back to the top of the page from the base of every feature, those features quickly become USELESS. I do not want to scroll down 50,000 times because the app only updates 5 items at a time then carries you back to the top of the screen and makes you scroll all the way back down before taking you back up to the top while it updates 5 more items by the time you get to a total of 30 items to review you have already spent your time scrolling back down most of the same list 6 times and you still haven‚Äôt gotten far past the initial 5 when you get to start all over again. Tired of reading all that run on sentence? Try reading a rerun run on sentence that starts all over every 5 words... üò°
title: Lots of nice useless features

review: I spent almost 40 minutes searching for my insurance card around my house after a long day at work..  I am young and moved to a new state for work, so haven‚Äôt used my insurance in 2+ years..  I finally have a dentist appointment for the next day, so was trying to get everything ready. Unfortunately, I was unable to find it.  I finally gave up and decided to see if I could screenshot it on my phone or email it to myself and print out at work...  to my surprise, after downloading this great app, they offer electronic ID cards!!!!!! I have been attempting to contact providers which Cigna displays as in-network, accepting new patients, etc, etc. 

I have complete understanding that they may be unable to keep this list updated to the minute, but when I call providers or facilities and request to make an appointment, 7/10 times I get told this provider doesn‚Äôt work here anymore.

The best answer I received was that a specific doctor hadn‚Äôt worked there in 5 years. 

Come on Cigna, get it together. You decide what to charge your insurance customers, if the money you‚Äôre charging us isn‚Äôt enough to manage your company properly, then charge more. 

If you‚Äôre just inept at running a business, then start handing out refunds or discounts. 

This is a disgrace to insurance providers and medical professionals through the country. 

Get it together. 

P.S. I try to do the right thing and notify you each time I come across incorrect information, so that someone else may not have to experience the same failures; but when I click on the ‚ÄúLet us know‚Äù button (which is directly referring to incorrect information in the listing) you re-route me, out of the app, into safari, I have to login again and to then have to find the provider again  and go through the whole process again is just ridiculously cumbersome. 

Another sign that you are not able to manage an app as it should be in the 21st century.
title: Completely Outdated Provider Lists

review:
I rarely think to leave a review for an app, but the Cigna app is uniquely bad enough that I am. This app used to be able to store my password but now it makes me re enter my password every time. Even my banking app is able to enter my password with Face ID so i‚Äôm not sure why Cigna isn‚Äôt able to use the same functionality even if there is sensitive information on the app. I used to teach coding to elementary aged children and am beginning to wonder if this app was a child‚Äôs school project. 

Worse yet, when I was at the optometrist recently I noticed that when I click on the section that is supposed to show me my vision coverage, I am instead shown my medical and behavioral health coverage. How can I verify that I am getting the rates I am supposed to get from my doctor if I can‚Äôt access this information on the go? I‚Äôm pretty sure I got ripped off on my purchase of contacts because of this.
title: Missing several core functionalities

review: I really appreciate all the features and conveniences of this app. It enables me to track HSA transactions as well as all claims. I also like how it helps me keep track of deductibles and out-of-pocket expenses. However, one thing that I want to be able to do within the app that I can‚Äôt seem to do is go back to review info from the previous year. For example, we had a significant medical emergency in our household on Christmas day. While I am able to view claims as they are processed from that health event, even after the start of the new year, I can‚Äôt view the overall deductible/out-of-pocket expenses tracker for 2017. I now only have access to the new trackers for 2018. I would appreciate being able to still view that info from 2017, for a few months into the new year anyway.
title: Pretty good but...

additionally, I was prompted to take a ‚Äúhealth assessment,‚Äù the first question of which was asking my ‚Äúgender identity,‚Äù but only male and female were offered as options. I understand why this information would be needed to provide medical recommendations, but changing the phrasing so that it‚Äôs asking my sex instead of gender identity *AND* offering more options would both be necessary in order to make this question answerable for a lot of users. the fake inclusivity in the way the question is phrased is actually making the user experience worse for queer people and intersex people.

review:
The Cigna app is convenient to use and has detailed breakdown of the bill, including the total charge, how much insurance pay and how much I owe. It also has the deductible status which reminds of how much out-of-pocket do I need to spend before the copay starts. There are also other features which I don‚Äôt use very often. Overall I will recommend this app.

If there is anything to improve, I‚Äôd suggest enhance the claim sorting function to include ‚Äòwhat I owe‚Äô. After all this is my out-of-pocket expense. Also, it will be very helpful to have a summary table to include all the breakdowns instead of going into each one claim to see the breakdown. An exporting function via email will be desirable as well.
title: Overall positive

developerResponse: {'id': 10618556, 'body': "Hello. I'm so sorry you've had trouble logging into the app. Please email me at LetUsHelpU@cigna.com. I would be glad to look into this for you. -CM", 'modified': '2019-09-10T21:39:07Z'}
review:
OVERALL THE APP WORKS OK.
But the log-in issues DRIVE. ME. NUTS.
I‚Äôll explain for anyone who may be interested 
 I use encrypted passwords, coupled to a secure e-vault service. Therefore, I know, I DO NOT forget passwords. Yet some websites and apps, including CIGNA, seem unstable with regard to retaining their password databases. I always wonder if IT Personnel willy nilly clear out their password data, thinking wrongly (IMHO), that forcing users to chose new passwords adds a level of security. Even if  dumping the database did add a level of security, not requesting that by done by users AT THEIR CONVENIENCE is just wrong. Not being able to login is usually highly disruptive.
For those using encrypted passwords, the only time I feel vulnerable to letting a hacker in, is when I have to send a new encrypted password during reset.
title: Don‚Äôt Like Security Created Issues

developerResponse: {'id': 32244255, 'body': 'Hello Andrew, I am very sorry for the difficulties you have experienced with our app and finding a provider. Please write to us at LetUsHelpU@Cigna.com and we will be happy to help. Thank you - N.J.', 'modified': '2022-09-26T23:43:20Z'}
review:
I have encountered multiple difficulties attempting to find care through this app.

When I first tried to find a Primary Care Physician, I was turned down by a few people who were not accepting new patients, even though the app said they were.

I have recently been searching for a Physical Therapist, and there is no way to filter for care providers other than the general title (i.e. ‚ÄúPhysical Therapist‚Äù). I called one that was listed as in-network and accepting patients, but was denied because the app failed to show that the Physical Therapist was actually working for a women‚Äôs only hospital, specializing in one practice, and not even in my network (I would have needed an additional subscription).

I tried using the ‚ÄúChat With Us‚Äù feature and got nowhere. It ended with the Cigna assistant sending me an email of possible Physical Therapists near me. This did not help at all, because the list included Physical Therapists I had already called and been denied care from due to specifications that were missing from the app (which I had already told the assistant multiple times).

Really hoping that this can be addressed. I use the app because I do not know if there is another way to find and get care through Cigna.
title: Poor and misleading ‚ÄúFind Care‚Äù feature

review:
Love this app! My favorite part is that it makes it so easy to review recent claims: I can choose parameters for what I want to review. For example, I can choose to review only medical claims for me in the last 30 days. Or I can review only dental claims for my daughter within the last 90 days. I can further specify only paid claims, or those that were denied, being processed, being appealed, or have been adjusted, etc. I also love that I can "Live Chat" if I have a question. 
Three suggestions for improvement: 
1. Make "Live Chat" available 24/7 (or see #2)
2. Allow me to send a message/ask a question to be answered by customer service via return message the next day. 
3. Allow me to see status of requests for pre-certification/preauthorization. For example, after my doctor submits a request, I'd like to be able to see if it was received, if it's under review, whether or not the request was approved or denied, and the reason for that decision. 
Thank you Cigna!
title: MJM

Having technical issues and contacted customer support. Resolving my issue then causes another issue and as soon as the issue is resolved the customer service rep leaves and you have to wait another 20-30 minutes to reach someone else. Started this process at 9am and after solving each issue one by one it‚Äôs now 2:30pm and I‚Äôm onto my 6th customer service rep because none of them can seem to check to make sure their advice works before they kick you out of line. 

This app is a complete waste of time at this point. Any convenience it would‚Äôve provided has been negated by the 3 day process it‚Äôs taken to simply access my plan. Just order physical cards and save yourself the headache of dealing with this nonsense. It‚Äôs 2022, if you can‚Äôt get an app right then why even try.

I have been a Cigna member for many years. The company has been prompt paying many medical bills for me; however, I have a recent issue with Cigna about reimbursement for hearing aids. I purchased hearing aids from Costco on July 9, 2020. It is now October 30, 2020. 
Before my purchase, I contacted Cigna and was assured that the out-of-network was covered. The hearing aids I bought were less than half of the price that I‚Äôve paid audiologists in the past. 
I have received many promises from Cigna customer service representatives that the claim is being processed. I have sent them eleven pages of documentation for this claim. Three months have passed with no refund. No one will give me the information to contact a supervisor in the claims department. I have contacted an attorney and will be filing a suit in Small Claims Court to be reimbursed for my Cigna approved hearing aid purchase.

Not user friendly, not customer oriented. Seem to work harder at finding ways to decline service than facilitating good service.
Do Not Recommend.

1) Already submitted reimbursement requests shouldn‚Äôt be found by clicking the ‚ÄúSubmit Reimbursement‚Äù button. Change the name or put current requests someplace else. 

2) Requests from the previous year disappear on Jan 1 even though the previous 30 days is used as a filter. There‚Äôs no way that I‚Äôve found to be able to find requests submitted in December other than to login to the website on a computer (and even then it‚Äôs a hassle).
title: Reimbursement Request Suggestions

developerResponse: {'id': 26409251, 'body': 'Good morning, I apologize for the issues you are having with the mobile app. Please email me at LetUsHelpU@Cigna.com. I would be glad to help. Thanks-DN', 'modified': '2021-11-22T12:49:55Z'}
review:
What happened to the claims section? Until this week I could see info on pending claims but it‚Äôs all gone now. The interface has gone childishly cartoon-like with similarly limited usability. Finally, the app continues refusing to accept biometric sign-ins despite multiple updates since that particular problem first arose. 

The in-app chat doesn‚Äôt allow typing so app reviews is apparently the place to complain directly to the company? This seems a poor choice on Cigna‚Äôs side.
title: A Few Bad Updates?

review: Literally had a toothache in the middle of the night, went to my app to find out what will my expenses be to find a oral tooth surgeon. It took me 5 mins maybe a little less to get all the information I needed. Only thing is it shows that most dr are accepting new patients but when you call they say they are not so that‚Äôs something small they can keep updates with.
title: Nice app

developerResponse: {'id': 17331231, 'body': "Hello, I'm terribly sorry for the trouble you've been experiencing with the app. I'll be happy to look into this for you. Please email me at LetUsHelpU@cigna.com - JW ", 'modified': '2020-08-17T16:03:22Z'}
review:
I mean, if you have the insurance, not having the app is not an option. But several pretty core features are just totally malfunctioning. 

- cannot add id card to apple wallet
- chat covered by keyboard
- info fields not properly formatted for type of information. If coded correctly, my phone should be able to auto-fill my address. As it stands, these are all text/number fields
- blur effect is sloppily timed. Just stop it. Makes the user feel like their vision is messed up. 

That said, getting help via chat is great, if only the keyboard would shift the dialogue box up, it‚Äôd be usable. I am frankly in disbelief that something so basic can be dysfunctional, almost as if the software was completely untested on an actual iphone (tried with two, verified problem occurs on multiple screen sizes).

I wrote this review almost a year ago and didnt post it. They have failed to fix their app so, here‚Äôs a bad review. Don‚Äôt waste your time trying to use their broken chat.
title: Really needs polish

review: With hospitals and independent medical providers it would be very difficult to know what you owe any specific vendor and any time. Before I used this app I was constantly stressed wondering g what was paid what was not how much I owed. Now when I get a bill like today I go in the app do a comparison and send them a check. I love this app. I have had extensive medical bills for two years now and am totally on top of this due exclusively to this app.
title: Awesome app

review: I have been able to track my health statistics over the past few years using this app. It has been very helpful to track my progress with my blood pressure and my cholesterol. For someone who doesn‚Äôt have problems with certain types of statistics I can just imagine how helpful it would be for someone who does need to accurately track their health information.
title: Helpful and I formative

review: The app works well and does what I need it to do. My only complaint is that my login credentials are not persisted when the app is updated. So each time there‚Äôs an update, I have to log in again and reactivate biometrics. The app is updated frequently enough for this to be annoying. If my banking apps can persist my credentials when updated, I‚Äôm sure Cigna can too.
title: Works well except for logging in after every update

review:
I like the app, very useful and easy to use. Writing a review so you know that when I clicked on the driving directions button to get to a new doctor appointment, the Destination it took me to was 5 miles from where I was trying to get. The address for the doctor is correct the doctor page but the driving directions are way off when it opens the map feature on an iPhone.

Please tell your app developers to fix.
title: GPS does not work

review: I like having all these features available in an app, which I can access via Touch ID, but on my iPad it is just a larger version of the iPhone app. My first time using the app, and I was chatting with a rep about finding an in-network provider. I‚Äôm happy with all the features available, and only thing I would ask for is a iPad version - since I prefer doing banking, medical, etc on my iPad - which stays at home - versus my phone which is carried outside the home.
title: Scaled-up on iPad

review: As a newly independent insurance carrier, this app has made things so easy! I forgot my card before a doctors appointment and downloaded it in the waiting room hoping to get my insurance card. Not only that, but I‚Äôve spent many hours searching through the app and looking things up just to familiarize myself with my plan and the coverage and how health insurance works. Love the app and highly recommend to everyone!!
title: Great app!!

review: This is the best and most informative health care app I have ever used. This app is easy to navigate and my information is updated regularly. I like having the ability to keep track of billing, deductibles, and incentive rewards all in one place, at anytime and on the go! It even shows when a prescription has been filled so I know what to expect to pay before I get the pharmacy! Fantastic app!!

As a basic app, it‚Äôs pretty good in that handy information is easily accessible (ID card, posted claims, etc).

However, one obvious function that is missing is the ability to SUBMIT claims.  This is a huge gaping hole that makes an already painful ordeal (manually submitting claims) even more painful (go to their website to submit) and dangerous for our personal, health information (copies of photos of our recents in who knows what locations).

review: It is easy to navigate, very intuitive. There is a wealth of information on Cigna on participating doctors. review:
The Cigna app works great - when it works. You can see a lot of info about coverage and access your cards and provider list. 
Unfortunately- if things go wrong, support for the app is clueless and in some cases only looks to transfer you to some other department. When I called in the first time the agent transferred me right away to Cigna medical customer service before even understanding what issue I had. The second agent was better, but his solution - delete and reinstall the app. Sad.

review:
Although I was feeling so poorly that I cannot recall the physicians name, he was amazing.

review:

The only thing I would love to see in this app is a calendar to populate appointments and locations that could then be sent to standard Lu used calendars.

Not being available while traveling does not make any sense. Not even showing an error message explaining that is unacceptable.

review:
